block.p: FLOWSERVE CORP., Irving, Tex., a chemical plant equipment company, agreed to sell a pump plant in Tulsa, Okla., in an attempt to win approval from the Justice Department for its proposed $775 million purchase of Ingersoll-Dresser Pumps, a unit of the Ingersoll-Rand Co., Woodcliff Lake, N.J.

MYND, Blythewood, S.C., a software company formerly known as Policy Management Systems, said it would not be receiving a bid from a second suitor, smoothing the path for the $16-a-share offer by the Computer Sciences Corp., El Segundo, Calif.

PERMA-FIX ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, Gainesville, Fla., a provider of hazardous-waste management services, agreed to buy an 80 percent stake in the East Tennessee Materials and Energy Corp. Terms were not disclosed.
WORLD AIRWAYS INC., Herndon, Va., which flies charter planes for other airlines, is moving its headquarters to the Atlanta area from Herndon.
